name: lime production, hydraulic | lime, hydraulic | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/6724/documentation

Contrary to clinker production, in this module no waste materials as fuel or secondary raw materials are included. Accordingly, no CO2-emissions from burning of waste are included. Other air emissions, assumed proportional to the fuel use, are estimated to be 88% of the emissions from the clinker calcination process, because the energy consumption is assumed to be 88% of the uses for clinker making. ;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



Includes the whole manufacturing process to burn hydraulic lime (raw material provision, grinding and mixing; rotary kiln process), internal processes (transport, etc.). For the infrastructure only the rotary kiln is taken into account (as material consumption). No administration is included.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2394:Manufacture of cement, lime and plaster

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: For some exchanges RER-modules have been used as proxy
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Copy of the clinker production technology with mainly adjustments of the energy amount and the emissions. Additionally some water for the hydration has been included.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: See geography This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography CH. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data adapted from module "clinker, at plant" based on literature
